cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast across Florida Big Bend tonight then accelerating northeast along the U.S. Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coast before stalling just offshore of the New Jersey/Delaware area late Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coastline between Suwannee River and Mexico Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Oregon Inlet including Pamlico Sound
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Surf City NC; Englewood FL to Suwannee River FL; west of Mexico Beach FL to Walton/Bay County line; Suwannee River to Mexico Beach under Hurricane Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Southeast Atlantic coast, Mid-Atlantic coast from NC to southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (15% cumulative) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; peak 6% onset probability Sunday with occasional gusts 25-35 kt possible along the Delaware River and coastal NJ.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port; only minor tidal anomalies (<3 ft) possible along the Delaware River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain possible Sunday into early Monday with 2â€“4 inches most likely; localized higher totals cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents and minor coastal erosion along nearby NJ/DE beaches that could affect harbor approaches.
